newsitem.title: UK: Lanica to report annual results on June 2.
newsitem.headline: Lanica to report annual results on June 2.

text.p: Lanica, the Guernsey-based investment trust run by entrepreneur Andrew Regan, on Friday said it will announce its 1996 results on June 2.
Its offshoot Galileo recently failed in a 1.2 billion stg attempt to take over the Co-operative Wholesale Society.

Lanica's shares -- which surged in 1996 after Regan took over when the stock was trading at 203 pence -- were suspended on February 10 at 19.50 stg when it emerged Galileo was attempting to take over the CWS.
Lanica has said its stock exchange listing could be restored once it publishes its annual results.
